Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Honeymoon \Hon"ey*moon`\, n. 1. The first month after marriage. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
2. A vacation taken together by a newly married couple, usually including a trip away from home. [PJC]
3. Hence: [fig.] Any initial period of harmony after two or more people or organizations begin working together; as, the usual honeymoon for a newly elected president was cut short by resumption of partisan sniping over the budget. [PJC]

honeymoon n 1: a holiday taken by a newly married couple 2: the early usually calm and harmonious period of a relationship; business or political v : spend a holiday after one's marriage; "they plan to honeymoon in Hawai'i"
